title: Need your feedback please
content:
Hello all! I need your opinion regarding the images attached, representing the company logo. The company offers Internet Marketing services. Please tell me which one of these images is suitable?  
I appreciate any advice.  
Thank you!

 [‹ Request for critical eyes ...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907001418/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43358 "Go to previous forum topic") [MooDog Logo Critique. ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907001418/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43639 "Go to next forum topic")
author: ioana toma

comments.content:
Dear Sharon, can you see it now?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907001418im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/logo%20webness%201_5737.JPG)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907001418im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/logo%20webness%202_4486.jpg)

Yes, I can. Thanks for reposting. I’m liking your first two the best.

Sharon

Thank you Sharon. You reinforce my first choice.  
From the first two, do you like more the black background or the other one? I really need to know because your opinion is really valuable! :)  
Sincerely, ioana

I’m having trouble perceiving a difference between the top two besides color. If you’re doing only web stuff, the color shouldn’t matter; just go with whatever suits the design and palette of the website. If you’re doing print applications, particularly letterhead, then you should stick with the one on the left (unless your client is set on somehow using black paper).

dear nvhladek, thank you. the one on the left will be my choice too.  
I appreciate all your comments.

Yes, Ioana, The first one is best. It shows the W as well as getting the chart graphline clearly and an electronic sense of communication.  
The bottom one is too busy looking.

ChrisL
The first one reminds me of a thread - as in screwed.

produce that logo at a small size and the text is GONE.

not a massive fan of the screw-like thread either.

—————  
**Paul Ducco**  
 [Logo Design Melbourne](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907001418/http:/www.solid-creative.com/)
